thread.title: BREAKING: Labour retains Stoke-on-Trent Central in massive blow to Paul Nuttall's UKIP
thread.title_full: BREAKING: Labour retains Stoke-on-Trent Central in massive blow to Paul Nuttall's UKIP

title: BREAKING: Labour retains Stoke-on-Trent Central in massive blow to Paul Nuttall's UKIP
text:
BREAKING: Labour retains Stoke-on-Trent central in massive blow to Paul Nuttall's UKIP BREAKING: Labour retains Stoke-on-Trent central in massive blow to Paul Nuttall's UKIP THE Labour Party has retained its heartland seat of Stoke-on-Trent Central after a close race between the opposition party and Paul Nuttall’s Ukip. PUBLISHED: 01:57, Fri, Feb 24, 2017 | UPDATED: 02:12, Fri, Feb 24, 2017 GETTY Labour's Gareth Snell has dealt a blow to UKIP after beating Paul Nuttall in the Stoke by-election 
The new Labour MP obtained 7,853 votes against Mr Nuttall's 5,233 votes. 
Mr Gareth Snell clinched the seat despite predictions Ukip leader Mr Nuttall could snatch up the midlands seat. All the action from Stoke Central by-election Thu, February 23, 2017 Voting has begun in the Stoke-On-Trent Central by-election which was called after sitting Labour MP Tristram Hunt resigned from his seat to be a museum director. The seat has always been a Labour stronghold but will see fierce competition from UKIP as they target people who voted for Brexit and the tradtional Labour working classes Getty Images 1 of 9 UKIP leader and candidate Paul Nuttall leaves the polling station after voting in the Stoke Central by-election 
Mr Snell was elected despite backing Remain in the European Union referendum. 
Almost 70 per cent of people in Mr Snell’s new seat backed Leave. 
More to follow...
